Package javelin.model.world

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class World
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Game world overview. This is focused on generating the initial game state. TODO would be nice to have tiles reflect the official d20 terrains (add desert and hill)
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    WorldScreen, Serialized Form

        public final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class<? extends Actor>,java.util.ArrayList<Actor>> actors

      • locations

        public final java.util.HashMap<Point,Location> locations
        Used o speed-up coordinate-based searches. Useful for long debugging operations as it speeds things up, safe to remove if troublesome. Don't bother registering non Locations because they can change coordinates often and are a minority. The performance gains would be irrelevant and definitely not worth the trouble of get it working right.

      • get

        @Deprecated
public static Actor get​(int x,
                        int y)
        Deprecated.
        This loops through all of getactors() with every call. Makes it really inefficient.
        Returns:
        Any actor on these coordinates.

      • get

        public static Actor get​(int x,
                        int y,
                        java.lang.Class<? extends Actor> type)
        Returns:
        Actor of the given type that occupies the given coordinates, or null.

      • getseed

        public static World getseed()
        Needs to be called during world building, as each WorldGenerator thread has a different world. During normal gameplay, seed can be accessed directly. TODO make sure this is only being used where necessary, to avoid the overhead
        Returns:
        If #building, the thread-relevant world instance, otherwise seed.
